intro: Hieracium grecescui, commonly known as the Greek hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and grasslands. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. Hieracium grecescui is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in temperate regions across Europe.
